revision.text:
{{Italic title}} {{Infobox book series | name = {{lang|fr|Découvertes Gallimard}} | image = [[File:Découvertes Gallimard, séries avec des codes couleurs.jpg|250px]]
[[File:Découvertes Gallimard & Abrams Discoveries & New Horizons.jpg|250px]] | image_caption = First row: {{lang|fr|Découvertes Gallimard}}; second row: ''Abrams Discoveries''; third row: ''New Horizons''. | editors = [[Pierre Marchand (editor)|Pierre Marchand]], [[Élisabeth de Farcy]] | translator = [[Ruth Sharman]], [[Paul Bahn|Paul G. Bahn]] et al. | illustrator = [[Dominique Thibault (author)|Dominique Thibault]], {{ill|Jean-Olivier Héron|fr}}, for {{lang|fr|pré-générique}} only (first 2 volumes), et al. | cover_artist = [[David Roberts (painter)|David Roberts]], [[Roland Cat]] et al. | country = {{FRA}} | language = [[French language|French]] | genre = [[Encyclopedia|Encyclopaedia]], [[Humanities]] | publisher = {{flagicon|FRA}} [[Éditions Gallimard]]
{{flagicon|UK}} [[Thames & Hudson]]
{{flagicon|USA}} [[Abrams Books|Harry N. Abrams]] | pub_date = {{flagicon|FRA}} 1986–present | english_pub_date = {{flagicon|UK}}{{flagicon|USA}} 1992–2008{{Cite web |url=https://thamesandhudson.com/cartier-bresson-9780500301241 |title=Henri Cartier-Bresson - Further Details |publisher=[[Thames & Hudson]] |accessdate=5 July 2017 |language=en-GB}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.abramsbooks.com/product/discoveries-henri-cartier-bresson_9780810998261/ |title=DISCOVERIES: HENRI CARTIER-BRESSON |publisher=[[Abrams Books]] |accessdate=5 July 2017 |language=en-US}} | media_type = Print ([[Paperback]], [[Hardcover]]) & Digital edition for iPad | number_of_books = 741:
Découvertes Gallimard (589),
Découvertes Gallimard : Série « Une autre histoire du XXᵉ siècle » (10),
Découvertes Gallimard Albums (13),
Découvertes Gallimard Texto (6),
Découvertes Gallimard Tirage limité (3),
Découvertes Gallimard Hors série (111),
Découvertes Gallimard Carnet d'expo (4),
Catalogues (5) | oclc = 638040265 | website = {{URL|http://www.decouvertes-gallimard.com}} }} {{lang|fr|'''Découvertes Gallimard'''}} ({{IPA-fr|dekuvɛʁt ɡalimaːʁ|lang}}, literally in English "Discoveries Gallimard"; in [[United Kingdom]]: '''''New Horizons''''', in [[United States]]: '''''Abrams Discoveries''''') is an [[Encyclopedia|encyclopaedic]] [[Collection (publishing)|collection]] of [[Book illustration|illustrated]], [[Pocket edition|pocket-sized books]] on a variety of subjects, aimed at adults and teenagers.{{Cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Divers/Plus-sur-la-collection/Decouvertes-Gallimard/(sourcenode)/116085 |title=Collection Découvertes Gallimard |publisher=[[Éditions Gallimard]] |accessdate=13 April 2017 |language=fr}} It was created by [[Pierre Marchand (editor)|Pierre Marchand]] and published by [[Éditions Gallimard]]. The first volume {{lang|fr|À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée}} (English-language edition: ''The Search for Ancient Egypt''{{Cite web |url=https://books.google.com/books/about/The_Search_for_Ancient_Egypt.html?id=msFfQgAACAAJ |title=The Search for Ancient Egypt (Thames & Hudson edition) |work=[[Google Books]] |accessdate=14 April 2017}}) appeared in November 1986, written by French Egyptologist [[Jean Vercoutter]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Archeologie/A-la-recherche-de-l-Egypte-oubliee |title=''À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée'', collection Découvertes Gallimard (n° 1) |publisher=Éditions Gallimard |accessdate=13 April 2017 |language=fr}} These scholarly little books then released in successive volumes, without a systematic plan, each of which is structured like a separate book (see [[monographic series]]). The collection currently contains more than 700 books, including spin-offs. == Overview == {{multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | width = 220 | header = ''The Sky: Order and Chaos'' | image1 = Zodiac in The Sky, pp. 40–41.jpg | alt1 = | caption1 = {{pp.|40|41}}: the [[Astrological sign|signs of the zodiac]], miniatures from a [[book of hours]]. | image2 = All Types of Comets, The Sky, pp. 80–81.jpg | alt2 = | caption2 = {{pp.|80|81}}: all types of comets, illustrations from {{lang|la|Theatrum Cometicum}} by [[Stanisław Lubieniecki]]. }} The A6 [[paper size]] (125 × 178 mm) is used for these mini books and printed on thick and glossy [[coated paper]], richly decorated with full colour illustrations, from which leap two or three images per page. In this picture-dense format, the authors must squeeze their words in edgewise. Each book of this encyclopaedic collection is composed of a [[monograph]] and focuses on a particular topic, the whole series covers all areas of human knowledge and experience,{{Cite web |url=https://www.thamesandhudson.com/catnh.html |title=New Horizons series |publisher=[[Thames & Hudson]] |accessdate=13 April 2017 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170606004639/http://www.thamesandhudson.com/catnh.html |archivedate=6 June 2017 |df=}} such as archaeology, art, culture, civilisation, history, music, religion, science, et cetera. There are 502 expert authors who have written for the collection. They usually use timelines and historical perspective to describe a subject,{{Cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard |title=''Collection'' Découvertes Gallimard |publisher=Éditions Gallimard |accessdate=14 April 2017 |language=fr}} for example, the 26{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Le ciel, ordre et désordre}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Sciences-et-techniques/Le-Ciel |title=''Le ciel, ordre et désordre'', collection Découvertes Gallimard (n° 26) |publisher=Éditions Gallimard |accessdate=28 October 2018 |language=fr}} (UK ed. ''The Sky: Order and Chaos''), which narrated in chronological order to present the varied subjects relating to the sky above and peoples' perception of it, through historical vision of cultural, social and religious aspects. Almost all the titles follow the same method, therefore, history is the essential element of perspective for this work. The [[Photo caption|captions]] for illustrations must be informative, they should not duplicate information in the [[body text]], nor do they interrupt the [[narrative thread]]. Researchers and academics must adhere to the constraints of a mainstream collection. Apart from obvious analytical abilities, authors are asked to write quality text and a sensitivity to illustration. A ''Découvertes Gallimard'' is not a book of authorship, the author is only one of the many speakers.{{Cite web |url=https://www.ricochet-jeunes.org/articles/decouvertes-gallimard-ou-la-culture-encyclopedique-la-francaise |title=Découvertes Gallimard ou la culture encyclopédique à la française |last=Hache-Bissette |first=Françoise |date=2001 |website=ricochet-jeunes.org |accessdate=26 September 2017 |language=fr}} [[Bruno Blasselle]], director of the [[Bibliothèque de l'Arsenal]], author of two volumes of {{lang|fr|[[:commons:À pleines pages : Histoire du livre, Volume Ⅰ|Histoire du livre]]}} ("[[History of books|History of the Book]]", № 321 and № 363), and co-author of the 88{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|La Bibliothèque nationale de France : Mémoire de l'avenir}}, explains his experience of working for the collection: "For an author, to write a ''Découvertes'' title is to be trapped, to put oneself in a situation of being obliged to go beyond his/her own formulation."{{cite episode |title=Dixième anniversaire de la collection Découvertes |series=Qu'est-ce qu'elle dit, Zazie ? |network=[[France 3]] |date=15 May 1997 |language=fr}} {{multiple image | align = left | header = Book spines | image1 = Découvertes Gallimard (les dos) Ⅰ.jpg | width1 = 175 | alt1 = | caption1 = "Découvertes Gallimard", the original edition. | image2 = Abrams Discoveries (book spines) Ⅰ.jpg | width2 = 190 | alt2 = | caption2 = "Abrams Discoveries", the U.S. edition. | footer = }} The cover design is one of the specificities. The old covers are glossy with black background illustrated in colour, the newer covers are matt-laminated rather than glossy, but more colourful, with different [[Color code|colour codes]] according to the areas.{{refn|group=note|Red for Arts, brown for Archéologie, blue for Histoire, white for Littératures, dark blue for Religions, yellow for Culture et société, green for Sciences et techniques.}} It differs from other documentary books by its visual: a full-size image, with its framing and the power of figurative elements, also an image that is well-matched to inside [[page layout]]. And there is always a tiny image that suits the theme to illustrate the [[Bookbinding|spine]]. The visual identity is strong, one can even easily recognise different language editions of ''Découvertes'' books. However, there are some exceptions, for instance, the Russian publisher [[AST (publisher)|AST]] adopted a completely different cover design for their {{lang|ru|«Открытие»}} ("Discovery") collection. {{multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | width = 240 | header = The 'trailers' | image1 = Opening of Ancient Rome, pp. 2–3.jpg | alt1 = | caption1 = 'Trailer' ({{pp.|2|3}}) for [[Claudia Moatti|Claude Moatti]]'s ''[[The Search for Ancient Rome]]''. Painting by [[Joseph-Louis Duc|Louis Duc]], 1830. | image2 = Реконструкція Табулярію та пам'ятників розміщених поруч з Капітолієм.jpg | alt2 = | caption2 = 'Trailer' ({{pp.|6|7}}) for [[Claudia Moatti|Claude Moatti]]'s ''[[The Search for Ancient Rome]]''. Painting by {{ill|Constant Moyaux|fr}}, 1866. }} Each title in the collection has around 200 pages with approximately 120–200 illustrations printed in four, five, six, or seven colours, both matte and glitter, and sometimes even [[Gold (color)|gold]], as in the 39{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Richard Wagner : L'opéra de la fin du monde}}, the metallic gold heightens [[Carl Otto Czeschka]]'s illustrations from {{lang|de|[[Nibelung|Die Nibelungen]]}}. Each book opens with 8–10 full-page illustrations or photographs, prefaced by a pull-quote on the inside front cove, which [[Thames & Hudson]] director Jamie Camplin calls it a "cinema-influenced trailer" (called {{lang|fr|[[Pre-credit|pré-générique]]}} in French). For the 96{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Champollion : Un scribe pour l'Égypte}}, this book opens with a succession of reproductions of [[Jean-François Champollion|Champollion]]'s manuscript {{lang|fr|[[Grammaire égyptienne]]}}; in {{lang|fr|[[L'Europe des Celtes]]}}{{refn|group=note|American edition – ''The Celts: Conquerors of Ancient Europe''; British edition – ''The Celts: First Masters of Europe''.}} (№ 158), the reader is greeted by a series of bronze masks and hoary faces carved in stone; the "trailer" for {{lang|fr|La Saga de l'espace}} (№ 3) evokes the tragic launch of the [[Space Shuttle Challenger|Space Shuttle ''Challenger'']] in 1986; while that of {{lang|fr|La Tour de Monsieur Eiffel}} (№ 62) presents the [[Eiffel Tower]] at every stage of its construction. [[File:Inside page view of “New York – Chronique d’une ville sauvage”.jpg|thumb|280px|Inside page view of [[Jerome Charyn]]'s {{lang|fr|New York : Chronique d'une ville sauvage}} ("New York: Chronicle of a Wild City"), the 204{{sup|th}} title of "Découvertes" collection. As an example of [[Page layout|layout]].]] The novelty lies in the subtle orchestration of the text and the illustration, where successive sequences, inserts and foldouts overlapping in double pages. According to the subjects, the [[Body text|body]] (mentioned as {{lang|fr|corpus}} in French) is structured into three to eight chapters. Each chapter is built using journalistic methods, with a [[lead paragraph]] and intertitle. The {{lang|fr|corpus}} is punctuated by double-page spreads of images, known as inserts, sort of a halt for pictures. For the 124{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|La peur du loup}} ("Fear of Wolves"), 2 double-page spreads of reproductions of [[Gustave Doré]]'s engravings to illustrate ''[[Little Red Riding Hood]]''. These books benefit a lot from journalistic and cinematographic techniques, some titles include [[Panorama|panoramic]] foldouts, kind of projection on big screen. Two foldouts in the 16{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Pompéi : La cité ensevelie}},{{refn|group=note|English edition title (both American and British) – ''Pompeii: The Day a City Died''.}} one showing [[Léon Jaussely]]'s reconstruction of the [[Forum (Roman)|forum]] of [[Pompeii]], the other representing the actual condition of the [[Theatre Area of Pompeii|theatre quarter]] in 1859 by using [[Paul-Émile Bonnet]]'s drawings, both in a panoramic view. In the 369{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Le papier : Une aventure au quotidien}} ("The Paper: A Daily Adventure"), through a partnership with paper companies, there are even three luxurious foldouts that all made on different papers from [[Arjo Wiggins]], presenting one of the 17{{sup|th}} century watercolours on the traditional manufacture of Chinese paper; the other of the engravings and drawings by [[Albrecht Dürer]] and [[Leonardo da Vinci]]; the third depicts today's paper [[production line]] with its different machines. At the back of each book is the "Documents" section ({{lang|fr|Témoignages et Documents}} in French), unlike the {{lang|fr|corpus}}, this part is always printed in black and white. It works as an anthology, provides more detailed documentary information and historical records. This includes [[wiktionary:dossier#English|dossiers]] made jointly by the author and the publisher, with lead paragraph to link texts and short captions for each dossier. According to the works, the annexes conclude "Documents" section with a chronology, an index, a filmography, a discography, or a bibliography. The sources of all images are always provided in the "List of Illustrations" ({{lang|fr|Table des illustrations}} in French) as well as photo credits, dedicated to those who want to do further research. ''Découvertes'' also stands out for its attention to detail. On the choice of [[typeface]], for example, [[Trump Mediaeval]] is used for common text, Barnattan for intertitles, [[Zapf Dingbats]] for [[guillemet]]s, [[Italic type|italic]] for captions with an [[initial]] and the last line is underlined, et cetera. The French editions are printed by Kapp Lahure Jombart in [[Évreux]], while the Italian printer Gianni Stavro, who has largely contributed to the elaboration of new techniques used in the collection, retains his position as collaborator for international reissues and coeditions. The bindings are solid, sewn and not glued. Gallimard promised readers "the most beautiful pocket collection in the world" ({{lang|fr|« la plus belle collection de poche du monde »|italic=no}}).{{Cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N5r-Eic9mSI |title=Découvertes Gallimard fête son n° 200 (1994) |work=[[YouTube]] |accessdate=13 April 2017 |language=fr}} The collection formerly consisted of 18 series—{{lang|fr|Archéologie}}, {{lang|fr|Architecture}}, {{lang|fr|Art de vivre}}, {{lang|fr|Cinéma}}, {{lang|fr|Histoire}}, {{lang|fr|Histoires naturelles}}, {{lang|fr|Invention du monde}}, {{lang|fr|Littérature}}, {{lang|fr|Mémoire des lieux}}, {{lang|fr|Musique et danse}}, {{lang|fr|Peinture}}, {{lang|fr|Philosophie}}, {{lang|fr|Religions}}, {{lang|fr|Sciences}}, {{lang|fr|Sculpture}}, {{lang|fr|Sports et jeux}}, {{lang|fr|Techniques}} and {{lang|fr|Traditions}}—which have been abandoned, it is now organised around 7 major areas: {{lang|fr|Arts}}, {{lang|fr|Archéologie}}, {{lang|fr|Histoire}}, {{lang|fr|Littératures}}, {{lang|fr|Religions}}, {{lang|fr|Culture et société}} and {{lang|fr|Sciences et techniques}}. == {{lang|fr|À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée}} == {{Infobox book | italic title = À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée | name = {{lang|fr|À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée}} | image = À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée (Découvertes Gallimard, nº 1).jpg | image_size = | border = yes | alt = | caption = The cover features ''[[:File:Desert of Gizeh by David Roberts.jpg|Desert of Gizeh]]'', a 19{{sup|th}}-century lithograph. | author = [[Jean Vercoutter]] | title_orig = À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée | orig_lang_code = fr | translator = [[Ruth Sharman]] | illustrator = [[Dominique Thibault (author)|Dominique Thibault]], for {{lang|fr|pré-générique}} only ({{pp.|3|9}}), et al. | cover_artist = [[David Roberts (painter)|David Roberts]] | country = France | language = French | series = Découvertes Gallimard●Archéologie | release_number = 1 | subject = [[Egyptian archaeology]],
[[history of Egyptology]] | genre = [[Non-fiction]] | publisher = FR: [[Éditions Gallimard]]
US: [[Abrams Books|Harry N. Abrams]]
UK: [[Thames & Hudson]] | pub_date = 1986 | english_pub_date = 1992 | media_type = Print ([[Paperback]]) & [[E-book]] for iPad (2012) | pages = 223 (first edition)
160 (new edition)
208 (UK & US editions) | isbn = 978-2-070-53028-1 | isbn_note = (first edition) | oclc = 1009489039 | dewey = | congress = | followed_by = {{lang|fr|Vie et mort des baleines}} | website = {{URL|http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Archeologie/A-la-recherche-de-l-Egypte-oubliee}} }} {{Quote|text=A world of stones. Stones of the pyramids, stones of the temples, stones of the statues. Drowned in the sand, bogged down, forgotten. A world of symbols. Engraved symbols, painted symbols. Mysterious, incomprehensible. A world that would come alive again under the gaze, the pencil, the trowel of travellers, adventurers, scientists, archaeologists. A world that would finally reveal its secrets, in 1822, thanks to [[Jean-François Champollion]].{{cite book |last=Vercoutter |first=Jean |date=1986 |title=À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée |series=Collection "Découvertes Gallimard" |volume=1 |language=fr |location=Paris |publisher=Éditions Gallimard |page=text on the back cover |isbn=978-2-070-53028-1}}}} [[File:Various language editions of À la recherche de l’Égypte oubliée.jpg|thumb|left|300px|Covers for different language editions of the first title {{lang|fr|À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée}}. From left to right, the first row: American, British, German and Taiwanese editions; the second row: Hispanic American, Russian, Romanian and Japanese editions. Covers in the first row share exactly the same design with Gallimard, whereas those in the second row are redesigned, and the rest which are not mentioned here also follow Gallimard's design framework.]] In the 4{{sup|th}} century AD, the Christian emperor [[Theodosius I]] decreed the closure of all the pagan temples in the [[Roman Empire|Empire]]. Unexpected consequence: the [[Egyptian hieroglyphs|hieroglyphic writing]], still alive until then, abruptly stopped being understood. The Pharaonic Egypt fell into oblivion. The [[French campaign in Egypt and Syria|expedition of Bonaparte]] in 1798 and the magnificent {{lang|fr|[[Description de l'Égypte]]}} aroused in Europe a craze for the monuments and the art of this ancient civilisation. The deciphering of hieroglyphs by young Champollion in 1822 marks the birth of [[Egyptology]]. From the transport of the [[Luxor Obelisk]] on the [[Place de la Concorde]] to the fabulous discovery of [[Tutankhamun#Legacy|Tutankhamun's treasures]], [[Jean Vercoutter]] recounts the history of rediscovery of ancient Egypt in this small volume—{{lang|fr|À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée}} (lit. "In Search of Forgotten Egypt"; English edition: ''The Search for Ancient Egypt'')—which inaugurated the collection "Découvertes Gallimard" in 1986. It is part of the {{lang|fr|Archéologie}} series; in other words, the book explaining the whole history of Egyptology—its birth and growth, with all the important figures in this history—{{cite web |url=http://evene.lefigaro.fr/livres/livre/jean-vercoutter-a-la-recherche-de-l-egypte-oubliee-27420.php |title=À LA RECHERCHE DE L'ÉGYPTE OUBLIÉE |author= |date=23 January 1998 |website=evene.lefigaro.fr |language=fr |access-date=3 November 2018 |quote=Toute l'histoire de l'égyptologie, de sa naissance à son essor avec toutes les figures importantes de cette histoire mentionnées.}}of the "search for forgotten Egypt", the study of archaeological sites, artefacts and documents discovered in Egypt in the 18{{sup|th}} and 19{{sup|th}} centuries. It's almost like a "[[graphic novel]]", replete with colour plates. There are seven chapters: * Ⅰ, "The Disappearance of Pharaonic Egypt" ({{lang|fr|La disparition de l'Égypte des Pharaons}}) evoking the deplorable events that were the [[destruction of the Library of Alexandria]] (it is said that there were seven hundred thousand volumes) and the [[Serapeum of Alexandria|temple of Serapis]] in the same city, missing in any of the buildings those precious texts which could clarify the gaps that exist today about the history of Pharaonic Egypt. Fortunately other sources remained available, the Bible being one of them, as the author well mentioned. * Ⅱ, "Travellers in Ancient Times" ({{lang|fr|Les voyageurs de l'Antiquité}}) recalls the journey and texts of [[Herodotus]], "the traveller par excellence", followed later by [[Diodorus Siculus]], [[Strabo]] (who was very interested in the [[Animal worship|animal cults]]) and [[Plutarch]] (who bequeathed us his version of the [[Osiris myth|myth of Osiris and Isis]], inspired by [[Manetho]]'s text, then preserved in a [[Ptolemaic Kingdom|Ptolemaic]] copy). The Roman emperors [[Hadrian]] and [[Septimius Severus]] are also included in the list of those illustrious travellers in the country of the Nile, preceded by the General [[Germanicus#Egypt|Germanicus]], member of the [[Julio-Claudian dynasty|imperial family]] in the time of [[Tiberius]]. [[File:View of Grand Cairo.jpg|thumb|300px|left|''View of Grand Cairo'', drawn by [[Henry Salt (Egyptologist)|Henry Salt]], early 19{{sup|th}} century. Image taken from pages 66–67 of this book.]] [[File:Great Harris Papyrus, Sheet 2.jpg|thumb|260px|The [[Papyrus Harris I|Harris Papyrus]] painting, depicting [[Ramesses III]] before the [[Theban Triad]]: [[Amun]], [[Mut]] and [[Khonsu]]. Image taken from page 91 of this book.]] * Ⅲ, "Crusaders, Monks, and Sightseers on the Banks of the Nile" ({{lang|fr|Croisés, moines et curieux au fil du Nil}}) recalling a time when the doors of [[Egypt in the Middle Ages|Muslim Egypt]] were virtually closed to the [[Christian West]]. It is true that in the time of the [[Crusades]] there were some texts emerged to lift the Islamic mantle that covered the historic region, but in any case travellers were scarce in south Cairo. Hence, "{{lang|fr|aucun des récits du Ⅰᵉʳ siècle ne sont comparables à ceux des Anciennes|italic=no}}"—at that time no one knew the [[Egyptian hieroglyphs|hieroglyphic]] texts anymore. Up to the beginning of the 19{{sup|th}} century, more or less illustrious visitors (the [[Dominican Order|Dominican]] [[Johann Michael Vansleb|Vansleb]], [[Jean de Thévenot]], [[Benoît de Maillet]], [[Claude Sicard]], [[Claude-Étienne Savary]], [[Constantin François de Chassebœuf, comte de Volney|comte de Volney]]), with special emphasis on General [[Napoleon|Bonaparte]] leading his army and his sages. * Ⅳ, "Treasure Hunters and Thieves" ({{lang|fr|Aventuriers et voleurs}}) – Bonaparte's expedition resulted in the most fruitful publication of two notable works, which are [[Vivant Denon]]'s ''Travels in Upper and Lower Egypt'' ({{lang|fr|Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Égypte}}) and {{lang|fr|[[Description de l'Égypte]]}}: "{{lang|fr|De 1802 à 1830, une dizaine de voyageurs de grand valeur, français, allemands, anglais, suisses, viennent voir sur place les merveilles révélées par le|italic=no}} {{lang|fr|Voyage}} {{lang|fr|et la|italic=no}} {{lang|fr|Description}}". It was then that Egypt became, it can be said, fashion. This led to the emergence of [[Egyptomania]] and, much more importantly, the birth of Egyptology. Then the author evokes the acts of European consuls and their active persons engaged in the procurement of antiquities (the [[Giovanni Battista Belzoni|Great Belzoni]] was one of them), sometimes using processes closer to prey and looting than meticulous prospecting. It is natural that this should happen in those days when archaeological method was still in development. * Ⅴ, "The Era of the Scholars" ({{lang|fr|L'Ère des savants}}) – The beginning of this era, with the expected prominence given to [[Jean-François Champollion]], who knew how to anticipate the efforts of several competitors ([[Thomas Young (scientist)|Thomas Young]], [[Johan David Åkerblad]] and [[Antoine Isaac Silvestre de Sacy|Silvestre de Sacy]]). Big names in the post-Champollionic phase are those of [[Karl Richard Lepsius]], founder of German Egyptology, [[John Gardner Wilkinson]], the "Father of British Egyptology", and [[Émile Prisse d'Avennes]], who sent a number of Egyptian antiquities to France. * Ⅵ, "Archaeologists to the Rescue" ({{lang|fr|Les archéologues au secours de l'Égypte}}) – After several decades of unbridled looting, of destruction of monuments, of contempt for the meticulous recording of the finds, came the archaeologists to rescue Egypt. Among them are: [[Auguste Mariette]], who would eventually die in Egypt occupying the high position of Director of Antiquities; [[Gaston Maspero]], Mariette's successor and [[Heinrich Karl Brugsch]], who was associated with Mariette in his excavations at [[Memphis, Egypt|Memphis]]. * Ⅶ, {{lang|fr|L'Égypte retrouvée}} (lit. "Egypt Regained"; chapter deleted in English edition) – This chapter evokes the works of [[Howard Carter]] in the [[Valley of the Kings]] ([[KV62|tomb of Tutankhamun]]), and [[Pierre Montet]]'s excavations at [[Tanis]] (tombs of [[Psusennes I]], [[Amenemope (pharaoh)|Amenemope]], [[Shoshenq II]] …), it's already in the first half of 20{{sup|th}} century. If the discoveries of the tombs of Tutankhamun and Psusennes had the international exposure, the truth is that almost every year new findings have been brought to light, many of which are only in the knowledge of the teams of work, of scholars and readers of specialised Egyptology journals. At a good pace, the discoveries continue today, methodically exploring the archaeological sites that exist not only in Egypt but also in [[Nubia]]; so "the philologists, epigraphists, historians can examine unearthed documents", and "Egyptology has passed the stage of childhood, it is entering its maturity". The following "Documents" section containing a compilation of excerpts which is divided into 19 parts,{{refn|group=note|The "Documents" section ({{lang|fr|Témoignages et Documents}}) contains: 1, {{lang|fr|La campagne d'Égypte}}; 2, {{lang|fr|La description de l'Égypte}}; 3, {{lang|fr|Le style «retour d'Égypte»}}; 4, {{lang|fr|Le long voyage des obélisques}}; 5, {{lang|fr|L'inauguration du canal de Suez}}; 6, {{lang|fr|Le voyage en Orient}}; 7, {{lang|fr|Des Américains aux pyramides}}; 8, {{lang|fr|Un officier de marine à Philæ}}; 9, {{lang|fr|Le Sérapéum de Memphis}}; 10, {{lang|fr|La résurrection de Karnak}}; 11, {{lang|fr|La renaissance de Philæ}}; 12, {{lang|fr|Le sauvetage d'Abou Simbel}}; 13, {{lang|fr|Histoires de pillages}}; 14, {{lang|fr|L'égyptologie aujourd'hui}}; 15, {{lang|fr|La journée d'un archéologue}}; 16, {{lang|fr|La nouvelle vie de Ramsès Ⅱ}}; 17, {{lang|fr|Les mystères des pyramides}}; 18, {{lang|fr|Sur la piste de Chéops}}; 19, {{lang|fr|L'Égypte au musée du Louvre}}.}} taken from texts by [[Jean Tulard]] on Napoléon's expedition in Egypt, [[François-René de Chateaubriand|Chateaubriand]] (''{{ill|Itinéraire de Paris à Jérusalem|fr}}''), [[Gustave Flaubert|Flaubert]] ({{lang|fr|Voyage en Orient}}), [[Maxime Du Camp]] ({{lang|fr|Souvenirs littéraires}}), [[Eugène Fromentin|Fromentin]] ({{lang|fr|Voyage en Égypte}}), [[Mark Twain]] (''[[The Innocents Abroad]]''), [[Pierre Loti]] ({{lang|fr|La Mort de Philæ}}), [[Auguste Mariette|Mariette]] ({{lang|fr|Le Sérapéum de Memphis}}); and, besides these big names, there are texts by modern Egyptologists such as [[Claude Traunecker]], Vercoutter himself on the [[Abu Simbel temples#Relocation|rescue of Abu Simbel temples]] and [[Jean-Claude Golvin]] (about the restoration works at [[Karnak]]), among others. The other documents recount the transport of Egyptian obelisks to Europe, the inauguration of the [[Suez Canal]], the mummy of Ramesses II under attack by fungi, the renewed attempts to discover the secret of the [[Great Pyramid of Giza|Great Pyramid]], the main works of art of the Egyptian collection at Louvre Museum, etc. The final document also includes references to comic books where Egypt is the theme (''[[Asterix]]'', ''[[The Adventures of Tintin|Tintin]]'' …). The book closes with a list of Ancient Egyptian deities (with images and explanations), complete chronology of Ancient Egyptian history (from 6000 BC to 639 AD), further reading, list of illustrations and an index. In his book review, the Portuguese Egyptologist {{ill|Luís Manuel de Araújo|pt}} praised the selection of illustrations for this work: "[…] this beautiful volume is valued by the excellent selection of images that lavishly accompanies the text", some of the illustrations belong to classic works from the early days of Egyptology, such as the {{lang|fr|[[Description de l'Égypte]]}}, [[Karl Richard Lepsius|Lepsius]]'s {{lang|de|Denkmäler aus Aegypten und Aethiopien}}, [[David Roberts (painter)|David Roberts]]'s ''Egypt and Nubia'', among others. De Araújo also notes the erroneous spelling for the divine name by using ''Khourou'' instead of {{lang|fr|Khonsou}} (in English: [[Khonsu]]) when mentioning the temple of this lunar deity at Karnak ({{p.|210}}); the name of the pharaoh of the [[Twelfth Dynasty of Egypt|12th dynasty]]—[[Amenemhat I]]—is wrongly written ''Amenhemat'' ({{p.|214}}), due to failure of revision; and the inexplicable absence of the famous English Egyptologist [[Flinders Petrie]], who introduced new methods of prospecting and registering the findings in archaeological research; and his contemporaries [[Adolf Erman]] and [[George Andrew Reisner]] are also being omitted.{{refn|group=note|This portion—"There are seven chapters: […] and his contemporaries Adolf Erman and George Andrew Reisner are also being omitted."—is based on the book review by Luís Manuel de Araújo, a Portuguese Egyptologist. See the original review in Portuguese here: {{cite web |url=https://digitalis-dsp.uc.pt/jspui/bitstream/10316.2/24232/1/Cadmo3_artigo24.pdf |title=[Recensão a] Vercoutter, Jean – À la Recherche de l'Égypte Oubliée |last=De Araújo |first=Luís Manuel |website=Biblioteca Digital da Universidade de Coimbra |language=pt-PT |access-date=29 October 2018}}}} This work was one of the bestsellers in France, has sold more than 500,000 copies worldwide as of 2001, and received a literary prize from the [[Fondation de France]] in 1987. It has been translated into [[American English|American]] and [[British English]], Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Czech, Danish, Dutch, German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Lithuanian, Norwegian, Polish, Romanian, Russian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish, [[Simplified Chinese characters|Simplified]] and [[Traditional Chinese characters|Traditional Chinese]], and reprinted several times. The first edition has 223 pages, a new edition was released in 2007, has only 160 pages. The [[E-book|electronic form]] for iPad of this book came out in 2012,{{cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Ipad/A-la-recherche-de-l-Egypte-oubliee |title=''À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée'', collection Découvertes Gallimard, série iPad |author= |date=9 October 2012 |publisher=Éditions Gallimard |language=fr |access-date=3 November 2018}} including a {{lang|fr|version enrichie}}.{{cite web |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=yhxZn0dAqOcC |title=À la recherche de l'Égypte oubliée – Version enrichie – Découvertes Gallimard |author= |date=2012 |website=books.google.com |access-date=3 November 2018}} == History == [[File:Découvertes Gallimard logo.jpg|thumb|left|Logo of ''Découvertes Gallimard'', it appears on the back cover and book spine, including "{{lang|fr|Hors série|italic=no}}" and some international editions.]] The ''Découvertes Gallimard'' collection was born in the [[Gallimard Jeunesse]], based on an idea by [[Pierre Marchand (editor)|Pierre Marchand]] after the publications of two pocket collections: ''Découvertes Cadet'' in 1983 and ''Découvertes Benjamin'' in 1984. These three Découvertes collections cater to three levels: grades 4 to 6 (''Découvertes Benjamin''), grades 7 to 9 (''Découvertes Cadet''), and grades 10 and up (''Découvertes Gallimard'').{{Cite web |last=Harber |first=Philip |url=https://www.umanitoba.ca/cm/cmarchive/vol16no3/frenchlanguageencyclopedia.html |title=French-Language Encyclopedias |year=1988 |website=[[University of Manitoba|umanitoba.ca]] |accessdate=30 December 2017}} This pocket encyclopaedia initially named {{lang|fr|Les chemins de la connaissance}} ("The Paths of Knowledge"), Pierre Marchand already had the idea when he entered Gallimard in 1972, as he explains: "I have invested fourteen years of my professional life in this collection. Thanks to the success of {{lang|fr|Livres dont vous êtes le héros}} that we were able to embark on this adventure […] For the first time, genuine encyclopaedias in pocket format […] Our bet is that once you open the book, no matter what subject you read or which page you are on, you can no longer close it."{{cite magazine |last= |first= |date=17 November 1986 |title=Comme un film documentaire |trans-title= |url= |language=fr |magazine=Livres Hebdo, n° 47 |location=Paris |publisher=Electre S.A. |access-date=}} [[Françoise Balibar]], [[Jean-Pierre Maury]], [[Jean-Pierre Verdet]], [[Marc Meunier-Thouret]] and some others were the first to experience this pharaonic project that would await the arrival of [[Élisabeth de Farcy]] and [[Paule du Bouchet]], in 1981, for truly to take shape.{{cite web |url=http://www.crilj.org/2011/07/02/une-vieille-histoire/ |title=Une vieille histoire |last=Lallouet |first=Marie |website=Centre de Recherche et d'Information sur la Littérature pour la Jeunesse (CRILJ) |date=2 July 2011 |accessdate=25 January 2018 |language=fr}} To produce encyclopaedias in pocket format and fully illustrated in colours, in that time, many judged such an editorial project insane. However, the collection was still created in 1986 and directed by Élisabeth de Farcy. She chose the authors and organised iconographic campaigns, several editors and iconographers were then gathered, copious illustrations were extracted from [[Cultural heritage|heritage]] resources. Élisabeth explained in an interview with {{lang|fr|[[La Croix]]}}: "The image should occupy a central place, as in a work of art."{{Cite web |url=http://www.la-croix.com/amp/276508 |title=Élisabeth de Farcy, directrice de la collection "Découvertes Gallimard" : "Une collection de poche à l'ambition encyclopédique" |date=13 November 2006 |newspaper=[[La Croix]] |accessdate=19 April 2017 |language=fr}} The authors were skeptical about this project at first, even contemptuous, but they are eventually fascinated by the collection. Some have even authored several works, such as [[Françoise Cachin]], curator of the [[Musée d'Orsay]], author of three books – {{lang|fr|Gauguin : « Ce malgré moi de sauvage »}}{{refn|group=note|English edition title (both American and British) – ''Gauguin: The Quest for Paradise''.}} (№ 49), {{lang|fr|Seurat : Le rêve de l'art-science}} (№ 108), {{lang|fr|Manet : « J'ai fait ce que j'ai vu »}}{{refn|group=note|American edition – ''Manet: The Influence of the Modern''; British edition – ''Manet: Painter of Modern Life''.}} (№ 203); or [[Jean-Pierre Maury]], who wrote four titles – {{lang|fr|Galilée : Le messager des étoiles}} (№ 10), {{lang|fr|Comment la Terre devint ronde}} (№ 52), {{lang|fr|Newton et la mécanique céleste}}{{refn|group=note|American edition – ''Newton: The Father of Modern Astronomy''; British edition – ''Newton: Understanding the Cosmos''.}} (№ 91) and {{lang|fr|Le palais de la Découverte}} (№ 195). A preview edition, or "zero edition" ({{lang|fr|numéro zéro}} in French) was sent to 500 booksellers during the summer of 1986, and officially released in November. The first twelve titles, twenty-five thousand copies of each volume were printed.{{cite magazine |last= |first= |date=8 December 1986 |title=Spécial Gallimard jeunesse |trans-title= |url= |language=fr |magazine=Livres Hebdo, supplément au n° 50 |location=Paris |publisher=Electre S.A. |access-date=}} "We've never seen so many things between the first and last pages of a book" is the slogan proposed by Pascal Manry's advertising agency for the launch of the collection. Without [[market research]] at the start, Pierre Marchand, a self-taught man, explained on the TV programme ''{{ill|Ça se discute|fr}}'': "This project was as old as my thirst for knowledge. No doubt it is necessary to be precisely self-taught to sense the importance of an encyclopaedia. We must have been forced to build our own culture, to seek reliable references, to make clear statements. To conceive ''Découvertes'', I didn't need market research, surveys or tests. Right from the start, I wanted to give the public the books I needed."{{cite magazine |date=December 1990 |title=Mon tout, c'est Découvertes Gallimard |trans-title= |url= |language=fr |magazine=[[Lire (magazine)|Lire]] |location=Paris |publisher=}} Although the ''Découvertes'' was constituted for youth at the beginning, it was launched for the general adult public in 1986. The collection then had a rapid-growth, 105 titles (volumes) appeared in five years. It acrossed the borders first time with the Spanish co-publisher {{ill|Aguilar (publisher)|lt=Aguilar|es|Aguilar (editorial)}} in 1989, and 19 countries will finally be associated with it. In 1992, after 151 titles have been published, Gallimard showed interest in the work on [[mermaid]] and [[Siren (mythology)|Siren]] ({{lang|nl|De lokroep van de zeemeermin}}{{cite book |last=De Donder |first=Vic |orig-year=First published 1992 |title=De lokroep van de zeemeermin |series=Standaard Ontdekkingen |url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/lokroep-van-de-zeemeermin/oclc/906635282 |website=[[Worldcat.org]] |language=nl |location=Antwerp |publisher=[[Standaard Uitgeverij]] |isbn=90-269-6350-5}}{{cite web |url=http://dbnl.org/tekst/_sep001199401_01/_sep001199401_01_0120.php |title=Bibliographie des oeuvres en langue néerlandaise parues en traduction française signalées en 1993 |date=1994 |website=[[Digital Library for Dutch Literature|DBNL]] |publisher= |accessdate=20 September 2017 |language=Dutch, French}}) by {{ill|Vic de Donder|nl}}, a [[Belgians|Belgian]] Dutch-language writer. Nevertheless, the Parisian publishing house hesitated: "Interesting subject, but how can you illustrate that?" Then De Donder showed a list of about one thousand images that he gathered over years, Gallimard was convinced and made him the first non-French-language author in this collection.{{cite news |last=Vlaminck |first=M. |date=24 October 1992 |title=Gallimard haalt De Donder binnen |trans-title= |url= |language=nl |newspaper=[[Het Nieuwsblad]] |page=15 |location=[[Groot-Bijgaarden]] |access-date=}} The heydays of the collection were at the turn of the 1990s, the authors are mainly recruited from [[academics]] and [[curator]]s. Numerous monographs of artists were often published on the occasions of major exhibitions, with a predilection for painters and musicians. Such as the 165{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Matisse : « Une splendeur inouïe »}}{{refn|group=note|British edition title – ''Matisse: The Sensuality of Colour''; American edition title – ''Matisse: The Wonder of Color''.}} was released for the exhibition "[[Henri Matisse]] 1904–1917" at the [[Centre Georges Pompidou]] in 1993; and Geneviève Haroche-Bouzinac's ''Élisabeth Vigée Le Brun'' (from "Hors série") was on sale at the exhibit of [[Élisabeth Vigée Le Brun|Vigée Le Brun]]'s paintings in [[New York City]] at the [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.versopolis.com/panorama/127/elisabeth-louise-vige-le-brun-and-the-art-of-seduction |title=Elisabeth Louise Vigée-Le Brun and the Art of Seduction |author=Diane Joy Charney |publisher=Versopolis |accessdate=3 May 2017}} Or reactivity in relation to current events, for instance, the 161{{sup|st}} title {{lang|fr|[[Sang pour sang, le réveil des vampires]]}}{{cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Culture-et-societe/Le-reveil-des-vampires |title=''Sang pour sang, le réveil des vampires'', collection Découvertes Gallimard (n° 161) |publisher=[[Éditions Gallimard]] |access-date=29 August 2017 |language=fr}}{{refn|group=note|British version title – ''Vampires: The World of the Undead''; American version title – ''Vampires: Restless Creatures of the Night''.}} was published in 1992 for the release of [[Francis Ford Coppola|Francis Coppola]]'s ''[[Bram Stoker's Dracula|Dracula]]'' in the same year; and {{lang|fr|La mine dévoreuse d'hommes}} (№ 184){{cite web | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=KEjSPAAACAAJ&dq=La+Mine+dévoreuse+d%27hommes | title = La mine dévoreuse d'hommes | publisher = [[Éditions Gallimard]] | website = [[Google Books]] | access-date=29 August 2017}} for the release of the French film ''[[Germinal (1993 film)|Germinal]]''; {{lang|fr|Un Conservatoire pour les Arts et Métiers}} (№ 222) for the [[wikt:bicentennial|bicentennial]] of the [[Conservatoire national des arts et métiers|CNAM]]; {{lang|fr|La Mode : Un demi-siècle conquérant}} (№ 511) was on sale on the occasion of "[[Yves Saint Laurent (designer)|Yves Saint Laurent]] retrospective" at the [[Petit Palais]] in 2010.{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/decouvertes/photos/a.113338219660.96877.110193529660/351170094660/?type=3&theater |title=Découvertes Gallimard |date=8 March 2010 |website=Facebook |publisher=Gallimard |accessdate=27 September 2017 |language=fr}} Some works were launched within an extremely limited time frame, such as {{lang|fr|Mémoires du Louvre}} (№ 60), for the inauguration of the [[Louvre Pyramid]] in 1989; and {{lang|fr|Les Temples de l'opéra}} (№ 77) for the [[Opéra Bastille]], in 1990, both completed in six to eight weeks instead of the usual two or three months. Alongside many works dictated by current events, there are also a number of favourites, sometimes strange, such as a book devoted to [[red hair]] (№ 338 – {{lang|fr|Roux et rousses : Un éclat très particulier}}), which is unusual in this type of collection. Some subjects can be more difficult to sell but considered necessary, such as the [[Perspective (graphical)|perspective]] (№ 138 – {{lang|fr|La Perspective en jeu : Les dessous de l'image}}), images of [[human body]] (№ 185 – {{lang|fr|Les images du corps}}{{refn|group=note|British version title – ''The Human Body: Image and Emotion''; American version title – ''Images of the Body''.}}) and [[mannerism]] (№ 457 – {{lang|fr|Le maniérisme : Une avant-garde au XVIᵉ siècle}}). But in recent years, there were more monographs on the memory of places and large institutions instead of artists, as well as various sociological and religious aspects, for instance, a book on the [[history of New York City]] by [[Jerome Charyn]], which is translated and adapted from his English work ''Metropolis: New York as Myth, Marketplace, and Magical Land'' (№ 204 – {{lang|fr|New York : Chronique d'une ville sauvage}}); volumes on [[homosexuality]] (№ 417 – {{lang|fr|La longue marche des gays}}) and [[Substance abuse|drugs]] (№ 423 – {{lang|fr|Les drogues : Une passion maudite}}); titles about [[Marian devotions]] and [[Marian apparition|apparition]] (№ 401 – {{lang|fr|La Vierge : Femme au visage divin}} & № 524 – {{lang|fr|Le monde de Lourdes}}). And also numerous volumes devoted to writers, for example, the 381{{sup|st}} title {{lang|fr|Marcel Proust : La cathédrale du temps}}.{{Cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Litteratures/Marcel-Proust |title=''Marcel Proust : La cathédrale du temps'', collection Découvertes Gallimard (n° 381) |publisher=[[Éditions Gallimard]] |accessdate=19 April 2017 |language=fr}} Difficult subjects were frequently in demand, possibly because there was less competition. Thus a book on the [[Cistercians|Cistercian monks]] (№ 95 – {{lang|fr|Le rêve cistercien}}) was one of the bestsellers in 1990. While the others like {{lang|fr|La fièvre de l'or}} (№ 34, about [[gold rush]]) or {{lang|fr|Sous le pavillon noir : Pirates et flibustiers}} (№ 45, about [[Piracy|pirates]]) are presumably subjects more common and popular, were relative failures. Generally, the most popular titles are those from {{lang|fr|Arts}} and {{lang|fr|Archéologie}} series, the first title and the 24{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|L'écriture, mémoire des hommes}}{{refn|group=note|English edition (both American and British) – ''Writing: The Story of Alphabets and Scripts''.}} (both in {{lang|fr|Archéologie}} series) remain two of the bestsellers. As of 2001, the former would have sold more than five hundred thousand copies worldwide. As for the {{lang|fr|Sports et jeux}} series, there are only 4 most favoured titles: {{lang|fr|La saga du Tour de France}} (№ 81), {{lang|fr|La balle au pied : Histoire du football}} (№ 83), {{lang|fr|Jeux Olympiques : La flamme de l'exploit}} (№ 133) and {{lang|fr|Voyous et gentlemen : Une histoire du rugby}} (№ 164). Competition has emerged as early as in the middle of the 1990s, circulation and novelties have been decreased gradually, but partially offset by another original collection {{lang|fr|'''Découvertes Gallimard Hors série'''}}, which is like a spin-off. Today, there are about fifteen old titles from the collection that are updated every year according to the current cultural and scientific research. History is the main point of ''Découvertes''. It is completed by archaeology, [[art history]] and science, richly accompanied by unpublished illustrations from ancient times to our days. Thus it forms a solid editorial base. On 25 March 1994, ''Découvertes Gallimard'' celebrated its publication of 200{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Voyages en Utopie}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Litteratures/Voyages-en-utopie |title=''Voyages en Utopie'', collection Découvertes Gallimard (n° 200) |publisher=[[Éditions Gallimard]] |accessdate=17 April 2017 |language=fr}} at the [[Musée national des Monuments Français]]. The collection underwent two successive redesigns, one in September 1998 (№ 359 – {{lang|fr|Le Théâtre de Boulevard : « Ciel, mon mari ! »}}) for exterior model (colour of book's back-cover, more explicit signage), and the other in March 2000 (№ 390 – {{lang|fr|L'Esprit des savoirs}}) for interior page layout. The "Documents" section of those re-editions is shortened, the average pagination of each volume decreases. The collection, which was too soon associated with a [[Channel surfing|zapping]] visual culture, reaffirmed its first purpose: the image does not take precedence over the text, but combined with text to animate and enrich the reading. These books benefit from the latest technologies, with their mockups are all made using [[Desktop publishing|DTP]] now. Since the [[QuarkXPress|X Press]] software was only released in 1987, the first 30 titles were made in a traditional way, with [[phototypesetting]]. The current price of a ''Découvertes'' book is between 8.40 and 15.90 [[euro]]s ([[Pound sterling|£]]7.95 in UK, [[United States dollar|$]]12.95–$14.95 in US and [[Canadian dollar|$]]19.95 in Canada) according to its category and number of pages, this is considered an extremely low price for a book of this quality. [[File:Encyclopedie de D'Alembert et Diderot - Premiere Page - ENC 1-NA5.jpg|thumb|''[[Encyclopédie]]'' is the first French encyclopaedia, a work edited by [[Denis Diderot]] and [[Jean le Rond d'Alembert]] and many other contributors. It was one of the first encyclopaedias to realise the form we would recognise today, also the first one to include contributions from many named [[Encyclopédistes|contributors]], and perhaps the most famous early encyclopaedia. The 100{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Le Roman vrai de l'Encyclopédie}} (lit. "True Novel of the Encyclopaedia") is dedicated to this work.]] ''Découvertes Gallimard'' has been translated into 19 languages{{Cite web |url=http://www.bibliomonde.com/collection/decouverte-749.html |title=Découverte |work=bibliomonde.com |accessdate=18 April 2017 |language=fr}} (in fact currently more than 20 languages, see [[Découvertes Gallimard#Appendix|Appendix]]), including Arabic, Chinese, Dutch, English, German, Italian, Japanese, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, et cetera. "This inexpensive pocket encyclopaedia embodies its [[Humanism|humanistic]] dream: to make the most advanced state of knowledge available to everyone. [[Denis Diderot|Diderot]] and [[Jean le Rond d'Alembert|D'Alembert]] would not have denied it…", notes Hedwige Pasquet, current director of Gallimard Jeunesse. According to ''{{ill|Livres Hebdo|fr}}'', these "French-style documentaries" ({{lang|fr|documentaires « à la française »}}) have sold over twenty million copies worldwide as of 1999,{{Cite web |url=http://next.liberation.fr/culture/1999/01/20/la-jeunesse-de-gallimard-chez-hachette-pierre-marchand-qui-a-cree-decouvertes-et-tout-le-secteur-jeu_261570 |title=La "jeunesse" de Gallimard chez Hachette. Pierre Marchand, qui a créé "Découvertes" et tout le secteur jeunesse, passe à la concurrence. |last=de Gaudemar |first=Antoine |newspaper=[[Libération]] |date=20 January 1999 |accessdate=27 December 2017 |language=fr}}{{cite magazine |last= |first= |date=January 1999 |title=Livres Hebdo (nº 321) |trans-title= |url= |language=fr |magazine=Livres Hebdo, n° 321 |location=Paris |publisher=Electre S.A. |accessdate=}} with recently emerging markets in the [[Eastern Europe]] and Asia, especially in Russia, about 100 titles have been published within four years. In order to remedy the problems of international proprietaries and reproduction rights of works of art, the co-publishers firstly define a number of titles, then they choose according to their own editorial line, and share the high cost of worldwide photographic rights. Therefore, [[Abrams Books|Harry N. Abrams]] in the United States chose more titles about traditional cultural subjects, while in Japan, the publisher {{ill|Sōgensha|ja|創元社}} prefers original titles, such as {{lang|fr|Les sorcières, fiancées de Satan}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.gallimard.fr/Catalogue/GALLIMARD/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Decouvertes-Gallimard/Culture-et-societe/Les-Sorcieres-fiancees-de-Satan |title=''Les sorcières, fiancées de Satan'', collection Découvertes Gallimard (n° 57) |publisher=[[Éditions Gallimard]] |accessdate=18 April 2017 |language=fr}} (lit. "The Witches: Fiancées of Satan") by {{ill|Jean-Michel Sallmann|fr}}. {{ill|Aguilar (publisher)|lt=Aguilar|es|Aguilar (editorial)}} from [[Madrid]] would be the first one among {{lang|fr|Découvertes Gallimard}}'s international co-publishers since 1989, the first 12 titles for the [[Peninsular Spanish|Spanish]] collection {{lang|es|Aguilar Universal}} were released in the same year.{{cite magazine |date=12 November 1989 |title=AGUILAR UNIVERSAL – La primera enciclopedia ilustrada a todo color en formato de bolsillo |trans-title= |url=http://hemeroteca.abc.es/nav/Navigate.exe/hemeroteca/madrid/blanco.y.negro/1989/11/12/101.html |language=es |magazine=[[Blanco y Negro (magazine)|Blanco y Negro]] |location=Madrid |publisher={{ill|Editorial Católica|es}} |accessdate=26 September 2017}} In Italy, the publisher Electa/Gallimard produced 128 titles within seven years; in Japan, the 166{{sup|th}} title of their collection {{transl|ja|Chi no Saihakken}} ("Rediscovery of Knowledge") has been published in early 2017.{{Cite web |url=https://www.sogensha.co.jp/productlist/detail?id=1686 |title=「知の再発見」双書166『ヴュイヤール──ゆらめく装飾画』|publisher=Sōgensha |accessdate=26 September 2017 |language=ja}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.cdjapan.co.jp/product/NEOBK-2049169 |title=Vuiyaru Yurameku Soshoku Ga / Original Title: Vuillard ("Shiri No Saihakken" Sosho) |publisher=Sōgensha |website=CD Japan |accessdate=26 September 2017 |language=en}} In addition, foreign editions are usually co-printed to amortise fees and support countries with small circulation. In addition to these foreign co-editions, ''Découvertes Gallimard'' has also been involved in institutional partnerships for several years, notably the one held since 1989 with the [[Réunion des Musées Nationaux]] (RMN): thirty-two titles have been released (as of 2001), plus a title in English dedicated to [[Jean-Baptiste-Camille Corot]] (№ 277 – ''Corot: Extraordinary landscapes''), [[Impressionism]] [[box set]] and four books in the "Hors série". The principle of these co-editions is based on a sharing of costs and revenues, the RMN brings its knowledge of museums and [[Content delivery network|distribution network]], while the publisher brings its editorial competence. When a title is linked to an exhibition, it generates a lot of additional sales through the RMN. Other partnerships with public or private companies, such as the [[French Alternative Energies and Atomic Energy Commission|CEA]] (№ 282 – {{lang|fr|L'atome, de la recherche à l'industrie : Le Commissariat à l'Énergie Atomique}}), [[Crédit Mutuel]] (№ 379 – {{lang|fr|L'odyssée de l'euro}}), [[L'Oréal]] (№ 405 – {{lang|fr|Les vies du cheveu}}{{refn|group=note|English edition – ''Hair: The Long and the Short of It''.}}), paper industries (№ 369 – {{lang|fr|Le papier : Une aventure au quotidien}}), et cetera. The partner is sometimes explicitly indicated in the "acknowledgments" (№ 379), but it is most often mentioned equivocally (№ 405), even modestly kept in silence (№ 389 – {{lang|fr|Vive l'eau}}). Documentary-style book publishing has been in decline in France for several years, [[market saturation]] is one of the causes, competition from other medias is another, especially from the internet. Despite its excellent image to the public, ''Découvertes Gallimard'' is also concerned by this disaffection. It remains an indisputable success internationally, but in France, the sales are eroding. The number of new productions decreases and also the prints. On 1 March 1999, the director of [[Gallimard Jeunesse]] and creator of ''Découvertes'', Pierre Marchand, after working for 27 years at Gallimard, left to become a [[creative director]] at [[Hachette (publisher)|Hachette]]. This was no doubt a big loss to the collection, but with more than 10 years of experience and a rich fund created over years, ''Découvertes'' finally surpassed the difficulties. The end of 2006 is marked by the celebration of {{lang|fr|Découvertes Gallimard}}'s 20{{sup|th}} anniversary and the publication of its 500{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Art brut : L'instinct créateur}}. On this occasion, a website was specially created for the collection, which is now the official website ''http://www.decouvertes-gallimard.fr''. On the occasion of [[Éditions Gallimard]]'s [[centennial]] in 2011, ''Découvertes Gallimard'' launched its first [[E-book|digital book]] for iPad: the 569{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Gallimard : Un éditeur à l'œuvre}} ("Gallimard: A Publisher at Work") by {{ill|Alban Cerisier|fr}}. == Image == {{multiple image | align = right | direction = vertical | width = 250 | header = | image1 = Measuring Temple of the Frescos.jpg | alt1 = | caption1 = Double-page spread of image in ''Lost Cities of the Maya''. Drawing by [[Frederick Catherwood]], 1844. | image2 = Double page d’image dan Saint-Pétersbourg, pp. 54–55.jpg | alt2 = | caption2 = Double-page spread of image in {{lang|fr|La magie blanche de Saint-Pétersbourg}} (№ 205). Painting by [[Eduard Hau]], 1853. | image3 = Vlad Țepeș in the book Vampires.jpg | alt3 = | caption3 = Full red background pages with engravings depicting [[Vlad the Impaler]] in ''[[Vampires: The World of the Undead]]''. }} Image is the essential part to ''Découvertes Gallimard'', the collection drew much inspiration from magazine [[Page layout|layout]] designs. Full colour pictures, documentary illustrations, archival photographs, historical maps occupy a central place in this work, as said Pierre Marchand himself: "the language of images is a universal language".{{cite web |url=http://www.parutions.com/pages/1-1-140-2851.html |title=Un entretien avec Pierre Marchand – Fondateur du département Jeunesse des éditions Gallimard |website=parutions.com |date=12 October 1999 |accessdate=25 January 2018 |language=fr}} But in the 1980s, [[Desktop publishing|DTP]] and photo digitisation did not exist, the sophisticated mockups were entirely handmade and the iconographers ran around museums, libraries, painting galleries and other agencies to look for documents. Today, the technology has simplified all these procedures but the difficulties are elsewhere, the status of the image is increasingly complex. Contemporary subjects often generate much higher costs since the publisher is obliged to work with photographic agencies. In the choice of documents, priority is given to those original, unpublished images. Besides, the iconographers of ''Découvertes'' have some exceptional documents, such as English explorer [[Frederick Catherwood]]'s original drawings of [[Maya civilization|Maya]] ruins decorate the 20{{sup|th}} title {{lang|fr|Les cités perdues des Mayas}}.{{refn|group=note|English edition title (both American and British) – ''Lost Cities of the Maya''.}} It's not difficult to illustrate subjects like arts, civilisations, archaeology... But when it comes to a theme like "[[pain]]" (№ 370 – {{lang|fr|La douleur : Un mal à combattre}}) or "[[sustainable development]]" (№ 495 – {{lang|fr|Le développement durable : Maintenant ou jamais}}), it becomes more delicate. The question is how to avoid repetitiveness or the flatly illustrative image, then the solution lies in a broadening field, through the use of historical documents, works of art and [[film still]]s. == Case study in aestheticisation movement == The [[wiktionary:aestheticisation|aestheticisation]] of [[Postmodernism|postmodern]] everyday life, according to [[Sociology|sociologists]] [[Michel Maffesoli]] and [[Mike Featherstone]], it seems to spring from two parallel movements rooted in [[modernity]], the so-called "dual postmodern aestheticisation movement": first an aesthetic [[hedonism]] (Maffesoli) and second the trivialisation of art (Featherstone). The second movement is the result of the de-[[Academic art|academisation]] and de-[[institutionalisation]] of art, thus "art is part of everyday life". ''Découvertes Gallimard'' is considered an example of 'art as part of everyday life' within this study. [[Pierre Marchand (editor)|Pierre Marchand]], Head of [[Gallimard Jeunesse]] who created the new kind of artistic encyclopaedia with a dynamic layout, that would be as much a magazine as an encyclopaedia. It has been described by a Gallimard employee that Découvertes "seduces like a magazine but has the duration of a book", kind of an objectified and specialised luxury magazine. A lot of work and research is done on the reproduction of images and the choice of illustrations, often unpublished documents like antique engravings, old photos, on all types of themes.{{cite web |url=http://newyorkmania.fr/2010/08/livre-new-york-chronique-dune-ville-sauvage/ |title=Livre — New York : Chronique d'une ville sauvage |date=4 August 2010 |website=New York Mania ! |accessdate=29 December 2017 |language=fr}} In this collection, all books share the same concept as to layout and looks, each book itself could become a work of art rather than only its substitute. It is coupled with up-to-date editing equipment, organisational innovations and a constant pursuit of higher printing quality at lower cost. And a more friendship than business relation between Marchand and the Italian printer Gianni Stavro has advanced the state of the art in printing. The suppliers of Découvertes are supposed to cooperate between themselves, "for instance, the French printer had a problem concerning the pigments, so the Italian printer invited him over to explain how he could solve the problem", explained by a Gallimard employee. Pierre Marchand might not be an "Artistic Master", but he is almost considered as such by his employees. {{lang|fr|Découvertes}}' staff work like a team, where everybody is concerned with everything at the same time. They share the same culture and values, their office is intentionally built like a vessel, with Marchand as 'captain' on the bridge, and anyone, at any time, is free to contribute with his/her own ideas about authors, pictures, front covers, …, and becomes leader of a project.{{cite journal |last1=Cova |first1=Bernard |last2=Svanfeldt |first2=Christian |year=1993 |title=Societal Innovations and the Postmodern Aestheticization of Everyday Life |url=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/256431763_Societal_innovations_and_the_postmodern_aestheticization_of_everyday_life |journal=[[International Journal of Research in Marketing]] |publisher=[[Elsevier]] |location=Amsterdam |volume=10 |issue= |pages=297–310 |doi= |accessdate=27 April 2018 }} == Spin-offs == * {{lang|fr|'''Découvertes Gallimard Hors série'''|italic=no}}: The title roughly translates as "off-series" or "off-collection". "Hors série" books are even smaller (120 × 170 mm, generally, but not always), each one consists of 48 pages with full colour illustrations. These books are designed like museum guide booklets, according to Gallimard, "{{lang|fr|des livres à visiter comme une exposition|italic=no}}" (lit. "books to visit like an exhibition"). Most of them are dedicated to artists like [[Sandro Botticelli|Botticelli]], [[Giuseppe Arcimboldo|Arcimboldo]], [[Jean-Honoré Fragonard|Fragonard]], [[Chaim Soutine|Soutine]], [[Gustave Le Gray|Le Gray]], et cetera, during major exhibitions devoted to them.{{Cite web |url=http://www.decouvertes-gallimard.fr/Decouvertes/hors_serie.go |title=HORS SÉRIE |publisher=[[Gallimard]] |accessdate=23 September 2017 |language=fr |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160307233650/http://www.decouvertes-gallimard.fr/Decouvertes/hors_serie.go |archivedate=7 March 2016 |df=}} * {{lang|fr|'''Une autre histoire du XXᵉ siècle'''|italic=no}}: Literally means "Another History of the 20{{sup|th}} Century". A closed series in ''Découvertes Gallimard'' collection released in 1999, consists of ten volumes for ten decades, written by French historian {{ill|Michel Pierre|fr|Michel Pierre (historien)}} and based on the [[Gaumont Film Company|Gaumont]] cinematographic archives. * {{lang|fr|'''Découvertes Gallimard Albums'''|italic=no}}: Consists of 13 volumes, 12 volumes released in 1992 and one in 1994, a larger format (210 × 270 mm) is used for these books. * {{lang|fr|'''Découvertes Gallimard Texto'''|italic=no}}: A 6-volume series released in 1998, inspired by the "Documents" section at the back of every ''Découvertes Gallimard'' book. The "Hors série" books are often coupled with exhibitions and it works well. While the other attempts to diversify the collection have often resulted in resounding commercial failures: the "Albums" and "Texto". Despite an interesting concept: the use of [[Film still|still images]] from Gaumont archives for "{{lang|fr|Une autre histoire du XXᵉ siècle|italic=no}}", this series has had mixed success. == Reception == French weekly magazine ''[[Télérama]]'' praised ''Découvertes Gallimard'', describing the work as "they borrow suspense from the cinema, have efficiency of the journalism, literary temperament is their charm, and art is their beauty". ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'' magazine described it "a lively interweaving of simple text and clever pictures".{{Cite magazine |last=Larson |first=Kay |date=6 December 1993 |title=Books: The Smart Set |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dyIAAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA127&lpg=PA127&dq=abrams+discoveries+series&source=bl&ots=wzBP2dsHp9&sig=8-6rDJa6R_g1sJO3WxxX9JX2C80&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiqlI3Z99fUAhWPJVAKHeWtCvs4ChDoAQgjMAA#v=onepage&q=abrams%20discoveries%20series&f=false |magazine=[[New York (magazine)|New York]] |location=New York City |page=127 |accessdate=25 June 2017}} German literary scholar and historian {{ill|Gerhard Prause|de}} wrote an article for ''[[Die Zeit]]'', reviewed the collection is an "adventure stands for surprise, excitement and amusement. Boredom is already prevented by the curiosity of vivid illustrations which are accompanied by detailed explanations".{{cite web |url=http://www.zeit.de/1990/52/abenteuer-geschichte |title=Abenteuer Geschichte – Eine spannende neue Reihe |author=Gerhard Prause |date=21 December 1990 |newspaper=[[Die Zeit]] |accessdate=17 April 2017 |language=de}} [[Rick Poynor]] wrote in ''[[Eye (magazine)|Eye]]'' magazine that the collection "is one of the great projects of contemporary popular publishing".{{cite web |url=http://www.eyemagazine.com/opinion/article/revelations-in-style |title=Revelations in style |author=[[Rick Poynor]] |date=24 September 2008 |website=eyemagazine.com |publisher=[[Eye magazine]] |accessdate=20 April 2017}} [[Raleigh Trevelyan]]'s article in ''[[The New York Times]]'' mentioned ''D-Day and the Invasion of Normandy'' from ''Abrams Discoveries'' series, said "all volumes in the ''Discoveries'' series are ingeniously designed".{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/books/98/08/16/specials/ambrose-dday.html |title=Telling It Like It Was |author=[[Raleigh Trevelyan]] |date=29 May 1994 |publisher=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=20 April 2017}} Art critic [[John Russell (art critic)|John Russell]] considered these books contain unique information, such as [[Claudius Aelianus|Aelian]]'s authority on the musicality of the elephant or the precise look of [[Halley's Comet]] as it was depicted in 1835.{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/11/01/books/while-you-re-saving-for-a-van-gogh-a-guide-to-inexpensive-art-books.html |title=While You're Saving for a van Gogh: A Guide to Inexpensive Art Books |author=[[John Russell (art critic)|John Russell]] |date=1 November 1992 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=21 April 2017}} In an article from the Argentine newspaper ''[[La Nación]]'', [[Eduardo Gudiño Kieffer]] said, "The books are excellent assistants for intellectuals, writers, journalists and students of different aspects of the culture […] they contain accurate and pithy information […] They obtain a cognitive 'duration' difficult to achieve in the [[Mass media|mediatic]] fugacity."{{cite web |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/214998-cultura-de-bolsillo |title=Cultura de bolsillo: CLAVES Por varios autores (Ediciones B) |last=Gudiño Kieffer |first=Eduardo |date=20 January 1999 |newspaper=[[La Nación]] |accessdate=13 January 2018 |language=es}} The Spanish newspaper ''[[El País]]'': "Those books combine an important 'Documents' section with an original thematic concept. It's obviously a popularised, educational work, but popularisation of very good level."{{cite web |url=https://elpais.com/diario/1989/12/24/cultura/630457207_850215.html |title=Aguilar edita la primera enciclopedia universal de bolsillo |newspaper=[[El País]] |author= |date=24 December 1989 |language=es |access-date=29 October 2018 |quote=Son libros que combinan una parte documental muy importante con un concepto temático original. Es una obra de divulgación, evidentemente, pero divulgación de buen buen nivel.}} The Brazilian newspapers – ''[[Folha de S.Paulo]]'': "What is most striking in the collection, however, is not the eclecticism or the unusual themes—usually developed by French experts—but the format and the iconographic content thereof.";{{cite web |url=https://www1.folha.uol.com.br/fsp/ilustrad/fq1504200022.htm |title=Coleção ilustra descobertas históricas |last=Caversan |first=Luiz |date=15 April 2000 |newspaper=[[Folha de S.Paulo]] |language=pt-BR |access-date=29 October 2018 |quote=O que mais chama a atenção na coleção, no entanto, não é o ecletismo ou o inusitado dos temas—em geral desenvolvidos por especialistas franceses—, mas o formato e o conteúdo iconográfico dos mesmos.}} ''{{ill|Diário do Grande ABC|pt}}'': "almost like a luxury comic magazine and of exquisite taste".{{cite web |url=https://www.dgabc.com.br/Noticia/273972/editoras-brasileiras-estao-otimistas-com-estilo-gallimard |title=Editoras brasileiras estão otimistas com estilo Gallimard |last=Marcos Coelho |first=João |date=1 June 2002 |newspaper=[[Diário do Grande ABC]] |language=pt-BR |access-date=29 October 2018 |quote=Quase como um gibi luxuoso e de extremo bom gosto.}} According to French magazine ''[[L'Expansion]]'', some other positive reviews including ''[[The Mail on Sunday]]'': "Revolutionary… Literally spectacular…"; ''[[The Times]]'': "A brand-new and daring collection"; ''[[Die Zeit]]'': "As soon as you open these handy books, you can not get away from them anymore"; ''[[The New York Times Book Review]]'': "A collection that recalls nineteenth-century encyclopaedias, where intelligence went hand in hand with curiosity".{{cite web |url=https://lexpansion.lexpress.fr/actualite-economique/gutenberg-fait-de-la-resistance_1409632.html |title=Gutenberg fait de la résistance |author=Roger Alexandre |date=20 December 1993 |magazine=[[L'Expansion]] |accessdate=3 January 2018 |language=fr}} The French news magazine ''[[L'Express]]'': "Real monographs, published as art books, offered in pocket format and sold at a pocket price […] ''Découvertes'' changed the face of [[Encyclopedism|encyclopaedism]] and art book, adapting the book to the era of '[[Channel surfing|zapping]]'."{{cite web |url=https://www.lexpress.fr/culture/livre/l-invention-des-decouvertes_810690.html |title=L'invention des Découvertes |last=Garcia |first=Daniel |date=1 November 2005 |magazine=[[L'Express]] |language=fr |access-date=31 August 2018 |quote=De véritables monographies, éditées comme des livres d'art, proposées en format poche et vendues à un prix poche […] « Découvertes » a changé la face de l'encyclopédisme et du livre d'art, adaptant le livre à l'ère du « zapping ».}} ''{{ill|Le Journal des Arts|fr}}''—a French bimonthly journal—calls the collection a "classic".{{cite web |url=https://www.lejournaldesarts.fr/medias/la-mue-des-decouvertes-gallimard-138599 |title=La mue des Découvertes Gallimard |last=Manca |first=Isabelle |date=28 June 2018 |website=lejournaldesarts.fr |language=fr |access-date=29 October 2018 |quote=C'est ce qu'il est convenu d'appeler un « classique ».}} It is also regarded by ''{{ill|Livres Hebdo|fr}}''—a French weekly magazine—as one of six collections that have marked the history of French publishing.{{cite web |url=https://www.livreshebdo.fr/article/decouvertes-gallimard-le-savoir-en-images |title=« Découvertes Gallimard », le savoir en images |last=Combet |first=Claude |date=11 May 2018 |magazine=[[Livres Hebdo]] |language=fr |access-date=29 October 2018 |quote=Cinquième volet de notre série sur six collections qui ont marqué l'histoire de l'édition française.}} Despite all the favours to its quality and attractive visual design, the collection suffers from a problem of identity in bookshops: where to put these books? With books for youth or books for adults? As pocket books or [[human science]] documentary books? And opt for a thematic scattering on the shelves. Many booksellers renounce the displays that were exclusively reserved for "Découvertes" due to high competition. All the more so because a rather tight inventory management at Gallimard, the complete titles are never available at the same time, which does not appreciate the customers. The problem of identification is also latent in [[print media]], the journalists, even if they are personally delighted to receive the new titles from a [[press agent]], would not be too enthusiastic about presenting a simple pocket book in their articles, even if it's a brand new title and not a reprint. == English edition == [[File:Logo of ‘New Horizons’ series.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Logo of 'New Horizons' series.]] [[File:T&H New Horizons (book spines) Ⅳ.jpg|thumb|300px|'New Horizons', the UK edition.]] ''Découvertes'' books have been selectively translated into English, published by [[Thames & Hudson]] in United Kingdom under the title '''''New Horizons''''' series,{{Cite web |url=https://thamesandhudson.com/books/filter-group/new-horizons-series |title=Books: New Horizons series |publisher=[[Thames & Hudson]] |accessdate=19 June 2017}}{{Cite web |url=http://www.publishinghistory.com/new-horizons-thames-hudson.html |title=''New Horizons'' (Thames and Hudson) - Book Series List |website=www.publishinghistory.com |accessdate=19 June 2017}} which launched its first titles in 1992 with the slogan, "the expanding universe between two covers". According to Thames & Hudson director Jamie Camplin, the remit is to "[[Educational entertainment|educate in an entertaining way]]".{{Cite web |url=http://www.eyemagazine.com/feature/article/in-the-beginning-was-the-picture |title=In the beginning was the picture |author=Jim Davies |work=[[Eye Magazine]] |date=Summer 1994 |accessdate=20 April 2017}} [[Paul Gottlieb (publisher)|Paul Gottlieb]], former director and editor in chief of the New York-based publisher [[Abrams Books]] (then called Harry N. Abrams), discovered Pierre Marchand's "Découvertes" collection at the Gallimard stand during the [[Bologna Children's Book Fair|Bologna Book Fair]] in 1991, which he called "a dazzling array of books" and an "imaginative combination of text and pictures in a magnificently produced series of paperback books". He began to negotiate for English language translation.{{cite web |url=https://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/print/20020527/24880-pierre-marchand-remembered.html |title=Pierre Marchand Remembered |author1=Hedwige Pasquet |author2=Christine Baker |author3=Christopher Davis |author4=Paul Gottlieb |author5=[[Herbert Lottman]] |author6=Dick Robinson |author7=Klaus Flugge |author8=[[Peter Mayer]] |date=May 27, 2002 |website=[[Publishers Weekly|publishersweekly.com]] |accessdate=17 March 2018}} The collection was eventually titled '''''Abrams Discoveries''''' series by the U.S. publisher. They began to publish in the spring of 1992, and more than 100 titles were produced.{{Cite web |url=http://www.abramsbooks.com/?s=Discoveries |title=Search Results: Discoveries |publisher=[[Abrams Books]] |accessdate=19 June 2017}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.thriftbooks.com/series/abrams-discoveries/90018/ |title=Abrams Discoveries series - 91 book (incomplete) |work=[[Thriftbooks]] |accessdate=13 April 2017}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.goodreads.com/shelf/show/abrams-discoveries |title=An incomplete list of Abrams Discoveries series |work=[[Goodreads]] |accessdate=18 January 2018}}{{Cite web |author=Barrie Kerper |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=pF4AZd6MUa4C&pg=PT609&lpg=PT609&dq=Discoveries+/+Harry+Abrams+illustration&source=bl&ots=k-IFvaLEfG&sig=qr7Cllceo3355RAVw8f0htre4ZE&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjzsZLCjbLTAhVIuBQKHfFMBt8Q6AEIYzAR#v=onepage&q=Discoveries%20%2F%20Harry%20Abrams%20illustration&f=false |title=Paris: The Collected Traveler |publisher=Knopf Doubleday Publishing Group |work=[[Google Books]] |accessdate=20 April 2017}} These two publishers share the translation costs, the American edition is then re-edited to take into account [[American and British English spelling differences|English spelling]], or vice versa. Unlike the original French edition which each volume has a number on the book's spine, the American and British editions are not put into numerical order. UK edition's book spines have titles in white with black background, while the more Gallimard-style US edition has titles in colour and sometimes with decorative features, like an {{larger|[[Ankh|☥]]}} for ''Cleopatra: The Life and Death of a Pharaoh'' and a {{larger|[[Fleur-de-lis|⚜]]}} for ''Heraldry: An Introductin to a Noble Tradition''. As for the "Documents" section, though some co-publishers print the entire French version, Thames & Hudson reformulates this part, tailoring the material to suit the nuances of the UK market. == List of English-translated volumes == {{main|List of English-translated volumes of Découvertes Gallimard}} == Documentary adaptation == In 1997, ''Découvertes Gallimard'' started its [[documentary film]] adaptations. The project is a co-production of [[La Sept|Arte France]] and [[Trans Europe Film]], in collaboration with Éditions Gallimard.{{cite web |url=http://download.pro.arte.tv/archives/fichiers/01776772.pdf |title=Collection DÉCOUVERTES: Une coproduction ARTE France / Trans Europe Film / Gallimard |date=2 March 2002 |website=[[Arte|pro.arte.tv]] |page=6 |accessdate=1 October 2017 |language=fr |format=PDF }} These 52-minute films are produced as episodes for [[Arte]] TV documentary series ''[[The Human Adventure (TV documentary series)|The Human Adventure]]'', most of them are directed by [[Jean-Claude Lubtchansky]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.lussasdoc.org/rea-jean-claude_lubtchansky-1,11795.html |title=Catalogue des films de Jean-Claude Lubtchansky |website=www.lussasdoc.org |accessdate=8 June 2017 |language=fr}} List of documentary films: {| border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" align="center" width="95%" !
